translations: n.（土地的）居住权，保有权；（尤指大学教师的）终身职位，长期聘用；（尤指重要政治职务的）任期，任职
v.授予……终身职位（尤指教师、讲师职位）

phrs.translation: 可授予终生职位的聘雇制度
职位/地位的稳定性；[经]使用期保障

sentences.sentence: It's still extremely difficult to get tenure.
sentences.translation: 要取得终身职位仍然极其困难。

sentences.sentence: I know they will continue to provide valuable guidance as I begin my tenure as an international civil servant.
sentences.translation: 我知道，当我开始国际公务员的任期时，他们将继续提供宝贵的指导。

sentences.sentence: There can be no question that throughout Delmont's tenure the average paycheck in this city has been getting steadily bigger.
sentences.translation: 毫无疑问，在德尔蒙特任职期间，这座城市的平均收入一直在稳步增长。
